messages: 69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:36): wow, a new spike of idiocy
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:37): work related?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:37): yup
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:37): the best kind
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:37): no no no, wait for it
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:37): so... my boss thinks that Froogle is the be-all-end-all
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:38): and we spend 10% of our revenue on advertising - mostly Google Adwords
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:38): so my roommate wrote this app for them when he was working there that does feeds for various services - one of which was Froogle
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:38): I wasn't running it often enough, so they gave it to my co-worker, who has nothing better to do
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:39): so, the president calls "oh shit oh shit oh shit we're not on froogle"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:39): so my boss calls "oh shit, we're not on froogle. Neither is your stuff"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:39): so I post him the links for my stuff and tell him to stop smoking crack, and to go log into Base for my co-worker's stuff
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:39): apparently my co-worker didn't get a base account
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:39): he's been FTP'ing it to Hedwig (Froogle server)
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:40): which, by the way, rejects all old logins

69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:40): so as a result, my boss had to go create a Base login, and try and manipulate some data from the feedloader - because he's not smart enough to fix Feedloader itself
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:40): so he uploads a XLS file, because he STILL doesn't understand XLS is binary, and renaming it to .csv DOESN'T WORK
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): and so he's telling me the description doesn't match
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): what doesn't it match? he doesn't know
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): so now I need to run the feed, then convert it to another data format, then run it through my tool which correctly creates froogle feeds
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): then do the bulk upload again
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): except... Base emails all results out
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:41): and he used his work email
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:42): I need popcorn, this just gets better and better
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:42): so... uh, I guess I'm retooling my php script to make it take data from any source instead of processing a query
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:42): you know, I'm going to write him a nice little perl script
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:42): and simultainiously teach myself perl
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:43): chaka: "feed status: disapproved" details showed that the upload "failed"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:43): help says: "hey numbnuts, TSV files aren't binary"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:43): whoops.
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:43): yeah, I love that renaming XLS to CSV
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:43): thats hot
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): chaka: well, I built a tool that does UPC lookups
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): it takes a CSV and does a whole bunch of stuff
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): so, I gave it to the president, who renamed his XLS file .CSV because my boss told him to (my boss is the head of IT)
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): so I told my boss very specifically not to do that, and he asked why not. After telling him 3 times I explained that binary != ascii
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): and he said "yes it does"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:44): "you can do that"
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:45): so, apparently renaming files can totally transform the contents, especially if you're using Windows XP CRACKSMOKER EDITION
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:45): your boss is the kind of guy Microsoft is targetting with Vista
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:45): with big red buttons and cool effects
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:45): although, come to think of it, that sounds like an interesting idea... transformations at the OS based on extensions
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:45): you could provide filters
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:45): ooh
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:45): chaka: write that down and give it to your boss
f676d6f993d218c809593f02705afc80 (06:46): Kog: As long as it's not their first OS, that'd be awesome.
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:46): freeone3000: qua?
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:46): Kog, actually, I patented that string as soon as freenode sent it my way, so you owe me money
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:46): chaka: eat shit and die capitalist pig
f676d6f993d218c809593f02705afc80 (06:47): Kog: Then you'd have peopel going "Why doesn't renaming it change the contents on Linux? It does it on YourOSNameHere..."
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:47): Kog, sortof an inside joke.  Every FTE here has atleast one patent plaque
2d0007bc5ad11988d4b3d019fe2fecbd (06:47): extensions must die
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:47): chaka: I doubt that
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:47): chaka: there are 300,000 employees
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:47): Kog, I'd take pictures for you as proof, but I don't want to get fired :p
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:49): Kog, let me put it another way, I've seen atleast 30 patent plaques in this building, and I've only met a small portion of people in building 10
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:49): heh, that doesn't mean every FTE has one ;)
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:49): it just means that MS loves to have patent rights
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:49): patently absurd ;)
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (06:50): ack, nosebleed
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:50): heh, damn dude, breathe
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:50): frb-away, I like extensions on unix the best, when they're purely descriptive
be97847377c73d525c8d6d2bc3bbc30d (06:50): .readme
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (07:02): it's always fun to name .csv files with -cvs to denote that it's not coming from svn ;)
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (07:02): you end up with lovely names like categories-cvs.csv
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (07:02): freeone3000: hey, have you ever used JSSE?
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (07:03): SpikeLite msdn2 update syntax
74b022cafa2831666188b297a3c5fca2 (07:03): Kog, Data-Binding Expression Syntax: http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms178366.aspx
69e2e9b6faa43ce63a2ecee941ecc641 (07:03): freeone3000: might be worth asking
